intro: Zornia lutescens, commonly known as the yellow zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Zornia lutescens is an important plant for local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
